servinfo.title: Windshield Wiper and Washer Switch Inspection

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Windshield Wiper and Washer Switch Removal and Installation

servinfosub.title: Windshield Wiper and Washer Switch
servinfosub.ptxt: Check for continuity between terminals at each switch position. If check result is not as specified, replace switch.

s1.ptxt: Turn the windshield wiper switch to “INT” position.
Connect battery positive (+) terminal to terminal “5” and its negative (–) terminal to terminal “2”.
Connect voltmeter positive lead to terminal “4” and its negative lead to terminal “2”.
Check that the voltmeter indicates the battery voltage (10 – 14 V).
Connect terminal “3” and terminal “5” by a jumper wire.
Disconnect end of the jumper wire from terminal “5”.
Connect disconnected jumper wire end to terminal “2”, then check that voltage between terminal “4” and terminal “2” changes as shown.
If check result is not satisfied, replace switch.
Make sure that front wiper switch is at “OFF” position.
Connect battery positive (+) terminal to terminal “5” and its negative (–) terminal to terminal “2”.
Connect voltmeter positive lead to terminal “4” and its negative lead to terminal “2”.
When front washer switch is ON, check that voltage changes as shown in figure.
If check result is not satisfied, replace switch.
